I just had a random thought:

For c++ namespaces, you can prepend `::` to declare that it is the start of a namespace (ie. `::gazebo::physics::Model`), perhaps we could use that syntax as well? If a world name is to be prepended, then prepend a `::` as well:
~~~
model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision
vs
::world::model_1::model_2::...::model_N::link::collision
~~~
We could use the initial `::` as a signifier that the world is included, otherwise it assumes a model name and whatever world is returned by `physics::get_world()`.
